page.title: 13TRANSPORT AND TRAVEL (1)
page.content: The Main Street in Thorner is classed as a 'B' road and it leads southwards to the main A64 Leeds-York trunk road. The village is linked by a half hourly bus service to Wetherby and to Leeds. By this means Thorner is linked to nearby villages of Bramham, Boston Spa, Thorp Arch and the towns of Tadcaster and Wetherby. There was a railway from Leeds to Wetherby, but this was closed in the 1960's. Embankments, bridges and the track bed were still to be seen in places in 1985. The site of the railway station has a cul-de-sac of houses, named Beeching Close. {(Lord {Beeching was the minister who closed {the railway). } The need for public transport has lessened as more people in Thorner and district use private transport like cars, bicycles etc.
